result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Motion and Order for Withdrawal of Counsel, filed by Atty Barnes

8:45 AM Defendant Michael R Reiter in court.  Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Michael R Reiter.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Barnes is asking for a short adjournment as the defendant has brought up a jurisdictional issue. No objection by the State. The Court will adjourn the preliminary hearing. Time limits were previously waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Atty Priya Barnes
Preliminary hearing on October 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

1:07 PM Defendant Michael R Reiter in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Attorney Andrew Herbers appearing as a friend of the court.  
Defendant states has not been provided counsel.  Atty. Herbers states the defendant did not want the public defender to represent him.  Defendant does not feel that he will get a fair trial and wants an attorney the will represent him at the best of their ability.  Atty. Herbers states he will get the defendant on the list to be appointed counsel as soon as possible.  Court finds time limits were previously waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:27 AM Defendant Michael R Reiter in court.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Michael R Reiter.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty. Miller moves to withdraw as counsel, new counsel will be appointed by the public defender's office. 
State does not object.
Court grants the motion to withdraw, time limits previously waived.
Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Hearing on September 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

The State does not object.
